mkns — makes a new namespace¶

The mkns command may be used to create a namespace, and optionally to set its description.

FORM

[fish] mkns path

FLAGS

  • -m description Sets the description (metadata) for a tag.

EXAMPLES

When authenticated as the user alice:

  1. Create a namespace called alice/secret

    $ touch secret

  2. Create a tag alice/very/secret with description “keep right out”

    $ touch -m "keep right out"  very/secret

NOTE

Namespace Tag creation is automatic on first use in fish. This command is only needed, therefore, if you wish to set permissions before use set permissions before use or specify a description.

The mkns command cannot be used (at present) to change the description of an existing namespace.

SEE ALSO:

mkdir (synonym)

touch — creates a tags and optionally sets their descriptions
